original: Yassa sarāgaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati tassa sarāgaṁ cittaṁ nirujjhissati na uppajjissatīti?
analyzed: yassa sa rāgam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati tassa sa rāgam cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati iti
translated: When there is a mind with lust that arises and does not cease, does a mind with lust that will cease arise?🔽At the moment of the arising of the last mind with lust of those with lust, a mind with lust arises and does not cease, and a mind with lust that will cease arises and does not cease. At the moment of the arising of the last mind with lust of those without lust, a mind with lust arises and does not cease, and a mind with lust that will cease arises and does not cease.

original: Sarāgapacchimacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ sarāgaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati, nirujjhissati na uppajjissati. Itaresaṁ sarāgacittassa uppādakkhaṇe tesaṁ …pe….
analyzed: sa rāga pacchima cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam sa rāgam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati nirujjhissati na uppajjissati itaresam sa rāga cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tesam pe
translated: At the moment of the arising of the last consciousness affected by lust, the consciousness affected by lust arises and does not cease; it will cease and will not arise. At the moment of the arising of the other consciousness not affected by lust, the consciousness affected by lust …🔽
